title: NYC Fashion + Accessories Bazaar at Grand Bazaar NYC
description: Indoors and outdoors at 100 W 77th St at Columbus Ave (UWS).
address: 100 W 77th St at Columbus Ave, Upper West Side

title: Schneider Concerts Chamber Music Series at The New School
description: Showcasing emerging musicians and ensembles, the New School’s annual chamber music series returns for the 2024-2025 season.
address: The Auditorium at The New School, Union Square

title: Greenwich Village Orchestra: ‘Resilience’ Concert
description: The 70-person community orchestra continues its 2024-25 season with a concert program featuring Valerie Coleman's Seven O'Clock Shout, Mozart's Clarinet Concerto, and Sibelius' First Symphony.
address: High School of Fashion Industries, Chelsea
cost: $15 general, $10 seniors/students with promo code ‘theskint’ (reg. $30 general, $20 seniors/students)

title: Scientific Controversies: Birdbrain
description: Learn about the neuroscience behind bird language, vocal learning, and the role of language in birds' flocking during a discussion with professors Erich Jarvis and Lauren Riters.

title: Beanie Babe Comedy
description: The standups and the stuffed animals are full of beans at this comedy show, where a donation will get you a vintage beanie baby to take home.

title: Disasterpiece Movie Night: Cool as Ice
description: From the weird to the wondrous, Disasterpiece unearths bad movies for a watch party complete with drinking games, trivia, pizza, and more.

title: Morbid Anatomy Krampus Holiday Market
description: BKone Tom Kane Theatre @ Industry City (Brooklyn). Free admission 12-5pm, $20 VIP admission at 11am.
address: BKone Tom Kane Theatre, Industry City, Brooklyn

title: Frost Moon Pop-Up Market
description: Caffeine Underground (Bushwick).

title: Brooklyn Tequila and Spirits Fest
description: Industry City - Building 5 (Sunset Park). Save 40% on advance tickets with promo code 'theskint'.

title: Regina Opera: Tosca
description: Brooklyn's Regina Opera presents a fully-staged performance of Giacomo Puccini's Tosca at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Auditorium (Sunset Park). The performance, sung in Italian with English supertitles, will be presented with full orchestra.
address: Our Lady of Perpetual Help Auditorium, Sunset Park

title: Tide Film Fest
description: The seventh annual Tide Film Fest (Truth Intent Disrupt Entitle), celebrating short and feature films written, directed, and/or produced by filmmakers of color, comes to BRIC (Fort Greene).

title: MOMA PS1 Open House
description: MOMA PS1 (LIC) celebrates the opening of two new exhibitions with free admission all day, performances, talks from artists and curators, family activities, and more.

title: Carnegie Hill Concerts New-Music Chamber Music Series
description: The Carnegie Hill Concerts series presents an afternoon with the Abeo Quartet, performing Schubert's String Quartet No. 14 (Death and the Maiden) and Reena Esmail's String Quartet 'Ragamala.'
address: Church of the Advent Hope, Carnegie Hill

title: Catch Performance Series
description: The Obie Award-winning Catch Performance Series returns to the Invisible Dog Art Center (Boerum Hill) with eight artists and a karaoke afterparty.
address: Invisible Dog Art Center, Boerum Hill

title: The Fantasy Tavern: Retro Games Edition
description: Partake in potion-packed revelry at the Fantasy Tavern, an interactive show and party featuring a cast of colorful characters performing drinking songs celebrating all things pop culture, fantasy, and D&D.

title: Free Red One-Inspired Scoops
description: While supplies last at Salt + Straw (Upper West Side).

title: Free Frozen-to-Thaw Magnolia Bakery Banana Pudding
description: Magnolia Bakery vending machine at Café Balearica (Williamsburg). While supplies last.

title: Rent the Runway’s Own Nothing (New) Closet Sale
description: Rent the Runway showroom (Union Square). Free entry.
address: Rent the Runway Showroom, Union Square

title: Starscape
description: Step into an immersive light installation celebrating Korean winter solstice at Genesis House (Meatpacking District). Created by Ethan Tobman, free admission.

title: Albertine's 10th Anniversary Celebration
description: Albertine Books, the largest bookstore in New York devoted to books in French and English, celebrates its 10th anniversary with a series of conversations and events featuring celebrated voices in contemporary literature and the humanities.

title: New York Comedy Festival
description: More than 200 comedians perform in more than 100 shows at venues throughout the five boroughs. Some skint-priced options include: Friday: Asscat @ UCB, PWI x POCs @ Brooklyn Comedy Collective, The Story Collider @ QED, Putería con Papirossa @ Littlefield; Saturday: ACAB: Angry, Crazy + Black with Sydney Duncan @ Brooklyn Art Haus, Christian Finnegan @ QED, Asian AF @ UCB, Bianca Parato @ Brooklyn Art Haus; Sunday: Rejected Shorts @ Caveat (save $5 with promo code 'nothanks').

title: Green-Wood Moonlight Tour
description: Under the glow of the full moon, explore Green-Wood Cemetery’s monuments and catacombs on this walking tour led by historian Jeff Richman.

title: Brooklyn Poets Fall Fellows Showcase
description: Fellowship winners from Brooklyn Poets’s fall workshop season share their work during an evening of readings at the org’s home base in Brooklyn Heights. Doors open at 6pm for a wine reception.

title: The World According to Allee Willis with Alexis Spraic
description: Angelika New York (Soho) hosts screenings of The World According to Allee Willis, Alexis Spraic's documentary about songwriter and art director Allee Willis (1947-2019). Spraic will be in-person for Q+A sessions following the 7pm shows Thurs + Fri.

title: Brooklyn Silent Film Festival
description: Eight musicians, bands, and composers unleash their original scores (performed live!) to eight new short silent films from around the world.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: See what all the brew-ha-ha is about at this women-produced and-hosted comedy show, returning to the back room at Halyards (Gowanus) with stand-up by Brian Paris (HBO), Rojo Perez (Fallon), Claire Parker (Celebrity Memoir Club), Phil Kostelecky (BBC), Molly Brenner (Edinburgh Fringe Fest), and Jason King.
